title: Recurring Toolchain Breakage Patterns
description: A curated feed of recurring failures in software compilers, linkers, build systems, and dependency managers, with impact vectors, evidence and suggested mitigations.
definition: A toolchain breakage signal is a recurring failure mode observed in compilers, linkers, build systems, or package managers that disrupts software development workflows.

fields.component: Name of the tool or subsystem where breakage occurs
fields.breakage: Description of the recurring failure pattern
fields.impact: Multi-dimensional impact classification on build, runtime, portability, compliance
fields.relevant_roles: Roles for which this breakage is relevant (e.g., developers, operations)
fields.time_sensitivity: Status of the breakage (ongoing/resolved) and suggested expiration period
fields.evidence: List of evidence sources referencing the breakage and their confidence weights
fields.corroboration: Number and types of independent sources confirming the issue
fields.first_seen: Date when the breakage was first reported
fields.last_confirmed: Most recent date the issue was verified
